body:
Problem: windows may scroll horizontally upon resize using the old terminal
size, which may be unnecessary and cause the content to be partially out-of-view.

Solution: reset the horizontal scroll after resizing.

Closes #35331

comment_regular_data.body:
I came up with this solution for now. We take a flag `may_resize` and set it in `terminal_check_size`. This flag is supposed to tell whether the proc running inside the terminal has responded to the resize. We set w_leftcol to 0 if may_resize is set. 

This seems to work but probably isn't the right idea. I feel terminal_recieve should have a better way to indicate that resize has happened.

Tbh I think that's mostly fine, though it might be better if `refresh_size` returns whether it changed the size and have `refresh_terminal` reset `w_leftcol` and call `curs_columns` for its windows if so after `refresh_screen`?
should we add a `screen:expect` after we set up screen? Ig that would fix macos test thats failing
Ah, I didn't realize I removed that `expect`. I was super confused for a while!
